elements.title: Brighton Aquarium (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Brighton Aquarium (entrance pictured) opened, it had no exhibits?

elements.title: Charleen Kinser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a mail-order catalogue offered a "Rocking Ram" toy, designed by Charleen Kinser, for US$1,600 in 1985?

elements.title: Called by Name (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the project Called by Name aims to commemorate Poles who were murdered for aiding Jews during World War II?

elements.title: Red Sea mangroves (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite a global decline in mangrove forests, Red Sea mangroves have expanded in area since 1972?

elements.title: Voyager 2 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Voyager 2 has been transmitting data for more than 46 years, making it the oldest active space probe in history?

elements.title: Brittany Luse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brittany Luse's podcast The Nod was praised for its exploration of "the diversity and richness of the Black experience"?

elements.title: 1964 New York World's Fair (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite lagging attendance at the 1964 New York World's Fair, its organizer rejected nearly every suggestion to increase attendance?

elements.title: David Marchese (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that David Marchese recalled accidentally posting a picture of a cat's testicles on Salon.com?
